MatchedRegion.transcript: which make them kind of infeasible for real world out of the options because in practice we really want options to be simple and robust.

MatchedRegion.Text: in practice, auctions need to be simple and robust

MatchedRegion.transcript: So they are easy for users to understand and they are easy for the standard to compute and they can tolerate inaccurate priors.
In this talk, we give a constant approximation posted price mechanism, which is both simple and robust for alibiders who are value maximizing subject to RI constraints.

MatchedRegion.Text: this talk: constant approximation posted-price mechanism (simple + robust) for autobidders (value-maximizing + ROl-constrained)

MatchedRegion.transcript: To complement this result, we show that there is a non-trivial lower bound for posted price mechanisms with autobidders.

MatchedRegion.Text: on the negative side: nontrivial lower bound for posted-price mechanisms

MatchedRegion.transcript: And as by-products, we also give results about dynamic auctions and combinatorial auctions

MatchedRegion.Text: byproducts: constant approximation dynamic auctions / combinatorial auctions
